quotes.quote: By desiring little, a poor man makes himself rich.
A poor man is like a foreigner in his own country.
The poor man wants many things; the covetous man, all.
The poor man commands respect; the beggar must always excite anger.
The poor man with industry is happier than the rich man in idleness.
A poor man is not the one without a cent. A poor man is the one without a dream.
The really poor man is not the one who lacks money, but the one who lacks the joy of the heart.
Be grateful that the poor man is there, so that by making a gift to him you are able to help yourself.
When a poor man gives something, that is a sacrifice indeed. When a rich man gives something, it hardly rises to the same level.
A poor man knows the true value of money and will not dare waste it, but a rich man is extravagant and always looking for an opportunity to empty his pockets.
A poor man's fear for money works against him.
Live and think like a poor man and you'll always be OK.
The poor man is poor because he will not heed instruction.
Almost every desire a poor man has is a punishable offence.
The poor man is ruined as soon as he begins to ape the rich.
He is a poor man who can only measure his wealth in dollars.
A poor man with nothing in his belly needs hope, illusion, more than bread.
The poor man's price of admittance to the favor of the rich is his self-respect.
The poor man really has a stake in the country. The rich man hasn't; he can go away to New Guinea in a yacht.
Poverty with joy isn't poverty at all. The poor man is not one who has little, but one who hankers after more.
In all conditions of life a poor man is a near neighbor to an honest one, and a rich man is as little removed from a knave.
I believe that honor and money nearly always go together... Seldom or never is a poor man honored by the world; however worthy of honor he may be, he is apt rather to be despised by it.
To give aid to every poor man is far beyond the reach and power of every man. Care of the poor is incumbent on society as a whole.
Ability is a poor man's wealth.
Even a poor man can receive honors.
Give, but, if possible, spare the poor man the shame of begging.
It is harder for a poor man to be successful than it is for a rich man.
